T2009 99833543 38020
THE TRADESMANS KALENDAR OF ACCOVNTS, OF EXCEL∣LENT VSE FOR ALL SORTS OF PEOPLE, AS WELL THE BVYERS AS SELLERS OF ANY COMMODITY. The use of the Booke in briefe is this, it containes 24 Columnes, over each Columne a title from the first to the last, exceeding one another a halfepenny, directing the buyer what to pay, as well as the sel∣ler to take, for ten, twenty, or thirty thousand ells, yards pounds &c. of any commodity whatsoever, supposing him to pay (for one) after any of these rates in the titles proposed. Take especiall notice that the first downright row of figures in each Co∣lumne, is the number of ells, yards, or pounds, &c. to be bought: the second, third, fourth, and fifth, stand for pounds, shillings, pence, halfepence: as L. S. D. &c. at the heads of each Columne signi∣fies. Vale. OXFORD, Printed in the Yeare, 1647. for I. B.
At a halfe penny the ell, yard, pound, gallon, or pottle, &c. 1 is worth   ob 10 0l 0s 5d 0 100 0 4 2 0 1000 2 1 8 0 2 0 0 1 0 20 0 0 10 0 200 0 8 4 0 2000 4 3 4 0 3 0 0 1 ob 30 0 1 3 0 300 0 12 6 0 3000 6 5 0 0 4 0 0 2 0 40 0 1 8 0 400 0 16 8 0 4000 8 6 8 0 5 0 0 2 ob 50 0 2 1 0 500 1 0 10 0 5000 10 8 4 0 6 0 0 3 0 60 0 2 6 0 600 1 5 0 0 6000 12 10 0 0 7 0 0 3 ob 70 0 2 11 0 700 1 9 2 0 7000 14 11 8 0 8 0 0 4 0 80 0 3 4 0 800 1 13 4 0 8000 16 13 4 0 9 0 0 4 ob 90 0 3 9 0 900 1 17 6 0 9000 18 15 0 0 At a penny the ell, yard, pound, gallon, pottle, or quart, &c. 1 is worth 1d 0 10 0l 0s 10 0 100 0 8 4 0 1000 4 3 4 0 2 0 0 2 0 20 0 1 8 0 200 0 16 8 0 2000 8 6 8 0 3 0 0 3 0 30 0 2 6 0 300 1 5 0 0 3000 12 10 0 0 4 0 0 4 0 40 0 3 4 0 400 1 13 4 0 4000 16 13 4 0 5 0 0 5 0 50 0 4 2 0 500 2 1 8 0 5000 20 16 8 0 6 0 0 6 0 60 0 5 0 0 600 2 10 0 0 600 25 0 0 0 7 0 0 7 0 70 0 5 10 0 700 2 18 4 0 7000 29 3 4 0 8 0 0 8 0 80 0 6 8 0 800 3 6 8 0 8000 33 6 8 0 9 0 0 9 0 90 0 7 6 0 900 3 15 0 0 9000 37 10 0 0
At three halfe pence the ell, yard, pound, or gallon, &c. 1 0l 0s 1d ob 10 0 1 3 0 100 0 12 6 0 1000 6 5 0 0 2 0 0 3 0 20 0 2 6 0 200 1 5 0 0 2000 12 10 0 0 3 0 0 4 ob 30 0 3 9 0 300 1 17 6 0 3000 18 15 0 0 4 0 0 6 0 40 0 5 0 0 400 2 10 0 0 4000 25 0 0 0 5 0 0 7 ob 50 0 6 3 0 500 3 2 6 0 5000 31 5 0 0 6 0 0 9 0 60 0 7 6 0 600 3 15 0 0 6000 37 10 0 0 7 0 0 10 ob 70 0 8 9 0 700 4 7 6 0 7000 43 15 0 0 8 0 1 0 0 80 0 10 0 0 800 5 0 0 0 8000 50 0 0 0 9 0 1 1 ob 90 0 11 3 0 900 5 12 6 0 9000 56 5 0 0 At two pence the ell, yard, pound, gallon, or pottle, &c. 1 0l 0s 2d 0 10 0 1 8 0 100 0 16 8 0 1000 8 6 8 0 2 0 0 4 0 20 0 3 4 0 200 1 13 4 0 2000 16 13 4 0 3 0 6 0 0 30 0 5 0 0 300 2 10 0 0 3000 25 0 0 0 4 0 0 8 0 40 0 6 8 0 400 3 6 8 0 4000 33 6 8 0 5 0 0 10 0 50 0 8 4 0 500 4 3 4 0 5000 41 13 4 0 6 0 1 0 0 60 0 10 0 0 600 5 0 0 0 6000 50 0 0 0 7 0 1 2 0 70 0 11 8 0 700 5 16 8 0 7000 58 6 8 0 8 0 1 4 0 80 0 13 4 0 800 6 13 4 0 8000 66 13 4 0 9 0 1 6 0 90 0 15 0 0 900 7 10 0 0 9000 75 0 0 0

At eleaven pence halfe penny the ell, yard, or pound, &c. 1 is worth 11d ob 10 0l 9s 7 0 100 4 15 10 0 1000 47 18 4 0 2 0 1 11 0 20 0 19 2 0 200 9 11 8 0 2000 95 16 8 0 3 0 2 10 ob 30 1 8 9 0 300 14 7 6 0 3000 143 15 0 0 4 0 3 10 0 40 1 18 4 0 400 19 3 4 0 4000 191 13 4 0 5 0 4 9 ob 50 2 7 11 0 500 23 19 2 0 5000 239 11 8 0 6 0 5 9 0 60 2 17 6 0 600 28 15 0 0 6000 287 10 0 0 7 0 6 8 ob 70 3 7 1 0 700 33 10 10 0 7000 335 8 4 0 8 0 7 8 0 80 3 16 8 0 800 38 6 8 0 8000 383 6 8 0 9 0 8 7 ob 90 4 6 3 0 900 43 2 6 0 9000 431 5 0 0 At twelve pence the ell, yard, pound, gallen, or pottle, &c. 1 0l 1s 0d 0 10 0 10 0 0 100 5 0 0 0 1000 50 0 0 0 2 0 2 0 0 20 1 0 0 0 200 10 0 0 0 2000 100 0 0 0 3 0 3 0 0 30 1 10 0 0 300 15 0 0 0 3000 150 0 0 0 4 0 4 0 0 40 2 0 0 0 400 20 0 0 0 4000 200 0 0 0 5 0 5 0 0 50 2 10 0 0 500 25 0 0 0 5000 250 0 0 0 6 0 6 0 0 60 3 0 0 0 600 30 0 0 0 6000 300 0 0 0 7 7 0 0 0 70 3 10 0 0 700 35 0 0 0 7000 350 0 0 0 8 0 8 0 0 80 4 0 0 0 800 40 0 0 0 8000 400 0 0 0 9 0 9 0 0 90 4 10 0 0 900 45 0 0 0 9000 450 0 0 0
